p.s: The given sequence is very important because it shows the police brutality in the USA and the situation black people have to deal with.
The scene starts with an establishing shot to show an overview of the situation.
One can see Starr and her family sitting at a table in a restaurant.
The camera walks from one person to the other.
There are many close up shots from different family members to see their facial expressions.
The conversation is dominated by over the shoulder shots because they are a typical way of presenting a conversation.
It makes you feel almost as if you're the one who is spoken to and it creates an intimate atmosphere.
The Carter'sCarters look happy as a family.
This reinforce the happy sounds which are played at the beginning of the scene.
When Starr looks outside the happy sounds stop playing.
Instead there is a dramatic sound playing in the background which makes the sequence more thrilling.
Starr's head turns in slow motion in the direction of King which makes the sequence more dangerous and exciting.
When Maverick, Starr's father, walks out of the restaurant towards King, the music gets louder and louder.
This creates an exciting atmosphere.
Also the high number of cuts makes the scene appear more hectic and it builds up suspense.
When the police arrives King and the gang members are already gone.
It seems like Maverick is scared.
When the black officer pulls him to the ground Starr and the other family members run outside.
This moment in this sequence is very dynamic and George Tillmann Jr. putputs a lot of effort into the direction.
When all the people record the situation, the officer is shown from a high angle perspective which makes him look very small.
When the police officers realise that they get filmed they leave very fast.
This shows that they're powerless.
The sequence is very important because it is about the main topic of the movie: police violence and racism.
Black people have to fight for equal rights.
They need to speak out for the same chances.
